original_title: Special Christmas visits: Prisons open doors for 3 per inmate, food & rules apply
original_body_lines: In anticipation of increased visitor volume during the Christmas period, the Department of Prisons, in collaboration with the police, will implement a special security program on December 24th and 25th, 2023.
Acting Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya has issued instructions to all prison superintendents to facilitate inmate visits under this program.
Following Prison regulations and health safety protocols, visits will be permitted at all island prisons on both days.
Each inmate will be allowed three visitors – relatives or friends – with each visitor receiving a single visitor pass.
Prison authorities urge family members to bring only enough food for one person and strictly adhere to the list of prohibited items posted at each prison.
